com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.sensors

Class SscManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.sensors.SscManager

  • public class SscManager
extends java.lang.Object

    SscManager lets you access Qualcomm's Snapdragon Sensor features on a device.

    Usage - 
    
 public class QCSensorActivity extends Activity, implements SscEventListener, SscConnectionStatusListener {
     private final SscManager mSscManager;

     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();

         //Check if Snapdragon Sensor SDK feature is supported on the device
         if (SscManager.isFeatureSupported(SensorFeature.FEATURE_ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION)){
             mSscManager = SscManager.getInstance(this);
             mSscManager.registerEventListener(SensorFeature.FEATURE_ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION, this);
         }
     }

     public void onAccuracyChanged(SensorFeature feature, int accuracy) {

     }

     public void public void onSscEventReceived(SensorFeature feature, Bundle data) {

     }

     public void onErrorReceived(SensorFeature feature){
     }

     public void onConnectionLost(){

     }

 }

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SscManager.SensorAccuracy
      Enum defining the accuracy levels for sensor events
      static class  SscManager.SensorActivityRecognitionState
      Enum defining the types of activity that can be classified by the API and are detected in activity recognition feature
      static class  SscManager.SensorAMDState
      Enum defining the types of activity that can be classified by the API and are detected in absolute motion detection feature
      static class  SscManager.SensorFacingState
      Enum defining the possible device facing changed events.
      static class  SscManager.SensorFeature
      Enum defining the individual features available on a device
      static class  SscManager.SensorGestureState
      Enum defining the possible sensor gesture events.
      static class  SscManager.SensorRMDState
      Enum defining the types of activity that can be classified by the API and are detected in relative motion detection feature
      static class  SscManager.SensorTapState
      Enum defining the possible device tap events.

    • Field Detail

      • KEY_MOTION_STATE_CONFIG

        public static final java.lang.String KEY_MOTION_STATE_CONFIG
        Configuration key to insert configuration values into the Bundle being passed to registerListener(Events event, SscEventListener listener, Bundle data).

        Value inserted into the Bundle should be either ConfigurationValues.CONFIGURATION_MOTION_STATE_PERIODIC or ConfigurationValues.CONFIGURATION_MOTION_STATE_ON_CHANGE

        See Also:

      • getInstance

        public static SscManager getInstance()
        Method to get the runtime instance of the SscManager object
        Returns:
        the runtime instance of the SscManager object

      • isFeatureSupported

        public static boolean isFeatureSupported(SscManager.SensorFeature feature)
        Method to check if a particular SSC feature is supported on the device.
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature enum to validate
        Returns:
        true if the requested feature is supported on the device; else false.
        See Also:
        SscManager.SensorFeature

      • registerListener

        public boolean registerListener(SscManager.SensorFeature feature,
                       SscEventListener listener)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Registers a SscEventListener for the given event type and no configuration provided
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to handle callbacks for
        listener - A SscEventListener
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - multiple exceptions may be thrown depending on how this method is implemented. Generic Exception used here as a placeholder
        See Also:
        unregisterListener(SscEventListener)

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(SscEventListener listener)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Unregisters a listener for the event(s) with which it is registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SscEventListener object previously registeres with the manager
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
